body:
What leaf Variable case are you thinking of? Here are the error messages when `input_var` is a leaf:

1) Leaf does not require grad, used in graph:
`"One of the differentiated Variables does not require grad"`
(unchanged)

2) Leaf does not require grad, unused in graph:
`"One of the differentiated Variables does not require grad"`
Previously:
`"One of the differentiated Variables appears to not have been used in the graph"`

3) Leaf requires grad and never used:
`"One of the differentiated Variables appears to not have been used in the graph"`
(unchanged)

4) Leaf requires grad, used for different operations, but not in this graph:
`"differentiated input is unreachable"`
(unchanged)

The error message for (2) seems fine to me, since input_var always needs to have `requires_grad=True`.
